title: Europe
name: Europe
description:
A Map by Finkster

Fabulous recommendations for traveling to Europe, focused mainly on Paris for now!  Lots of restaurants to work through.

properties.name: (Claude Colliot) Le Bamboche
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 15, rue de Babylone, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 45 49 14 40 Metro: Sevres-Babylone http://www.lebamboche.com/

properties.name: 1800 Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Reservations: +30 22860 71485 - Reservations required Located in the town of Oia on Santorini in the Cyclades Islands in Greece, this Slow Food restaurant is located in a beautful 19th Century mansion, formerly a captain’s house. Ia is walking only city, but the restaurant is easy to find on the north side of the main walkway on the way to the tip of the peninsula. 1800 focuses on a very complete single seating evening meal serving creative Mediterranean cuisine using local Santorini products. Pricey, but there are not many Slow Food restaurants in the islands, so make sure to give it a try for a special evening. Most importantly, don\'t forget to watch the sunset in Ia first over the Caldera, and don\'t forget those reservations! "At the “1800” Oia Restaurant in Santorini, not only are you offered an enjoyable meal, but also the chance to get acquainted with the local culture of Santorini. The aim of the owner and his colleagues is to familiarize its guests with the customs and traditions of Santorini and the Aegean Area in general." - "1800" "At the northern tip of the crescent, the village of Oia frosts the land with a cluster of white houses, many built by wealthy ship-owners in the nineteenth century. One of the most spectacular homes had been abandoned for more than three decades when architect Ioannis Zaggelidis began restoring it in 1986. He called it RESTAURANT 1800. The menu focuses on traditional Greek dishes, including roasted fish and a mezedes platter with local cheeses. Grilled lamb chops, a Greek classic, are served with an original touch: a sweet-and-sour green applesauce. All are enhanced by the view from the rooftop garden, the perfect spot for a certain wealthy ship-owner to be there in spirit." - Bon Appetit (May 2002)

properties.name: Antiche Sere Osteria
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 9, Via Cenischia, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 3854347 Reservations: Make sure to call ahead, only one seating per night Closed Domenica 30 minute walk from Puorto Nuovo, an amazing gem of a family run Slow Food restaurant featuring 3 generations in kitchen and waiting tables. We had veal tibbia, an amazing rabbit with marmalade, veal carppacio, fresh cheese, tagliettele with asparagus, incredible panna cotta and strawberry zabagione.

properties.name: Aranysarkany Vendeglo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster H-2000 Szentendre, Alkotmany u. 1/a, HungaryAnother easter egg! This very small Hungarian restaurant is easily missed walking through the pedestrian district i Szentendre 20 minutes out of Budapest, but it is definitely a must not miss. Walking in, the aroma of herbs set out on the table adjusts you to the home style kitchen and amazing local food you will find here. Don\'t forget to order a bottle of drier Tokaj wine, it\'ll go well with anything on the menu. Absolutely in my top restaurants list worldwide.

properties.name: Art Hotel Boston
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  70, Via Massena, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 500359 Wonderful boutique hotel with unique rooms, very clean and modern, and a very good value for the money. Highly recommended.

properties.name: Cafe Savoy
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  Vítězná 5, Praha 5 Beer: Staropramen on tap Beautiful decor recently restored, excellent fare all day and night, from the obligatory Goulash to excellent Schnitzel and french inspired food. You can\'t beat the quality for the price in Prague. Also excellent wine selection of Czech and eastern wines.

properties.name: Casa Olympe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 48 rue Saint-Georges, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 42 85 26 01 Metro: Saint-Georges, or Notre-Dame-de-Lorette

properties.name: Chez L'Ami Jean
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 27 rue Malar, 75007 Paris, FranceReservations: +33 01 47 05 86 89 required for both lunch and dinner Metro: Invalides Opened by a Basque nationalist in 1931, this tiny bistro has quietly emerged as one of the finest restaurants in Paris. I make sure to pay a visit every time I\'m in Paris, as the menu changes frequently, and it\'s not often you can get a taste of high end Basque influenced cuisine. My favorites include many of their daily soups which are served with toasted croutons tossed with vegetables and bacon, absolutely wonderful. Of course their menu changes regularly, but they typically offer amazing game (veal, venison), various poultry (pigeon, squab) and foie gras options as well. Typically very herbal flavors infused and paired with equisitely prepared vegetables. Also don\'t forget to try their desserts, they are truly special.

properties.name: Chez Marcel

properties.name: Chez Ramalaud
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 269 rue du Faubourg St. Antoine, 75011 Paris, FranceReservations: +33 01 43 72 23 29 Metro: Faidherbe-Chaligny, or Nation A wonderful old world neighborhood bistrot, serving traditional french bistro fair and comfort food, with a fantastic wine list. While the charm is wonderful, the food is a bit average. However, you won\'t be dissapointed with the wine bar.

properties.name: Hotel Centauro
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Campo Manin 4297, Venezia, ItalyTel: +39 041 5225832 Central to most of Venice and right on the canals, a beautiful boutique hotel with rich fabric covered comforting rooms, very well furnished.

properties.name: Hotel Isa
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 39, Via Cicerone, Rome, ItalyTel: +39 06-3212610 Nearby the Vatican, a newly remodeled modern hotel, each room with unique styling.

properties.name: Kacsa Vendéglő
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1027 Budapest, Fő utca 75, HungaryAnd yet another easter egg. You\'ve got to be kidding me how amazing this place is, absolutely the best Duck preparations you will find in the world. Kacsa specializes in crispy duck but keeps it incredibly moist. Don\'t hold back with your meal, start with the Poire William, Caviar, ask for recommendations on the Hungarian red wines. And of course, don\'t forget the Tokaj dessert wine. Kacsa also offers the finest service I have ever seen, you will experience warm and friendly waiters, while still having everything served under silver domed plates and platters, and wine decanted under candle light. Strongly recommend paying in cash, they may have a special suprise for you if you do, but they also take credit cards.

properties.name: Konzertcafe Schwarzenberg
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Karntnerring 17, 1010 Wien, AustriaPhone: +43 512.89.98 Absolutely my favorite traditional Viennese cafe and if you aren\'t familiar, Vienna is the best cafe culture in the world due to its elegance, desserts and food selection. This particular choice is arguably a close call to best in Vienna with the Sasher Cafe which created the Sasher Torte. Either way, located close to the Opera house in downtown Vienna, this beautiful high ceiling cafe has wonderful desserts, coffees (my favorite is the Fakir Coffee with the shot of Cherry Brandy) and good quality Viennese traditional food. Also a great place for Austrian beer and wine. This place is a class act and an easy place to just stop in to for a light snack or tea time.

properties.name: L'Agrifoglio Ristorante
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 38, Via dell\'Accademia Albertina, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 837064 Reservations: Call ahead Closed Domenica A short 10 minute walk from Piazza Castello, this very private Slow Food restaurant requires a reservation and doesn\'t have a sign above the door....bottom line, call ahead! Fantastic veal ravioli, and of course for the cheese lovers, order the "cheese clock" comprised of 12 different artisan cheeses arranged at each station of the clock.

properties.name: L'Os a Moelle
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3 rue vasco-de-gama, parisReservations: +33 01 45 57 27 27 Metro: Lourmel stop on #8 line Closed Sunday and Monday Very high quality neighborhood restaurant at an amazing price (30 Euro), serving only prix fixe menu of french cuisine. The menu is presented on a simple blackboard, offering 2 options for each of the six courses (the courses include a soup, entree, seafood, meat, cheese and dessert usually). Also, don\'t forget to try the Cave de l\'Os a Moelle across the street before or after your dinner...this neighborhood wine bar is a gem, serving family style serve yourself buffet style country food (foie gras terrine, pickles, preserved meats, lentil stew, etc.). You can eat a full meal casually if you like at the wine bar, but it\'s not the same food as the restaurant across the street. Their number is 01 45 57 28 28.

properties.name: La Cagouille
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 10 Place Brancusi, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 22 09 01 Restaurant Website: www.la-cagouille.fr.

Featuring a standard prix fixe menu du Manoir for 34E, and a Black truffle menu in the winter for 59E

properties.name: Le Villaret
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 19 rue Ternaux, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 57 75 56 Metro: Parmentier

properties.name: Les Allobroges
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 71 rue des Grands-Champs, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 73 40 00 Metro: Maraichers

properties.name: Les Bouquinistes
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 53, quai des grands augustins, paris franceReservations: +33 01 43 25 45 94 Location: on the Left bank 2 blocks off of Notre Dame & Ile St. Louis Metro: St. Michel (4), Odeon (4,10) On my regular restaurant list, I never fail to visit Bouquinistes as they have very inventive dishes from Chef Guy Savoy. Many of their dishes incorporate wonderful "frothy" light sauces, as well as extremely innovative soups and purees. Some favorites: * Cream of chestnut soup with wild mushrooms and a lyon sausage brioche. * Wild fowl and foie gras pate, cooked in a terrine with pears cooked in Sezchuan pepper and bitter lettuce salad * Royal dauarade lemon-thyme with wild mushrooms and sweet pumpkin .....and so much more, the menu changes regularly A bit on the pricey side, but the quality of the food is phenominal.

properties.name: Lvi Dvur
properties.description: Posted by Finkster U Prasneho Mostu 6, Prague 1 On the north side entrance to the castle (not the main entrance), sits Lvi Dvur, and absolutely amazing restaurant specializing in high end Czech cuisine with French influence. Suprisingly affordable for the quality, this is a must visit for foodies in an otherwise good but not great food town. Their specialty is the roasted pig, but everything I had on the menu was wonderful. For the beer freaks, they serve Kruscovice light and dark.

properties.name: Mon Vieil Ami
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 69 rue Saint Louis en l’Ile, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 45 61 09 46 Metro: Cite, or Pont Marie

properties.name: Pinxo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 9, Rue d’Alger, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 40 20 72 00 Metro: Tuileries

properties.name: Pivovarsky Dum
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Lipova 15 at Jecna, Praha 2 Tough to find a table at night, try during the day to make sure you can get in. A rare micro-brewery in Prague, while most restaurants are dominated by the amazingly good big brewery beers, Pivovarsky paves their own path and offers innovative twists as well as traditional style Czech beers. Try the green Nettle beer, quite a rare find. Food is good, try the Garlic Soup!

properties.name: Repaire du Cartouche
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 99 rue Amelot, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 47 00 25 86 Metro: Saint-Sebastien-Froissart

properties.name: Restaurant Vincent
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Address: Grosse Pfarrgasse 7, 1020 Vienna, Austria Reservations: +43 1 214 15 16 Email: office@restaurant-vincent.at Simply one of the finest dining experience I have had and for the large group that attended this dinner. Fantastic continental viennese style fusion food on this Degustation menu, you can pick any number of courses between 4-10. While a more modern architectural design, the service was sparkling and absolutely made you feel at home...they simply made the meal absolutely fun, and the food phenomenal. Simply tell your server what food types you DON\'T like, and put yourself in their hands...trust me!

properties.name: Shampers
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4 Kingly St, London, W1B 5PE, UKGreat little french bistro and wine bar. Ask for SImon the owner, a wonderfully kind gentleman who will give you fantastic recommendations for food and wine. Very inexpensive versus other London offerings.

properties.name: Sotto La Mole Ristorante
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 9, Via Montebello, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 8179398 Closed Mercoledi Slow food eating guide recommendation

properties.name: Table de Fes
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 5 rue Sainte-Beuve, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 45 48 29 94 Metro: Notre-Dame-des-Champs, or Vavin

properties.name: Trattoria Valenza
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 39, Via Borgo Dora, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 5213914 Closed Domenica, Lunedi a pranzo Slow food eating guide recommendation.

properties.name: Tynska Literarni Kavarna
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Tynska 6 right off of Old Town Square behind "Cinderella\'s Castle" Tyn church. OK, good luck finding this place, but if you do! Seriously though, when you\'re in the square, immediately on the left (north) side of the church, you\'ll find Tynska street under one of the archways. About 100 yards up Tynska (you\'ll go through a very small square first), you\'ll find an incredibly hidden door at Tynska 6, housing the best Bohemian cafe in a little cavern right behind the church. Better yet, beer is about 23 Koruna or . You\'ll find all sorts of interesting people and students in this "literary cavern".

properties.name: U Cerneho Vola
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Loreténske Néměsté 1 (just up the walking street from the castle) For being so close to the castle, you\'ll never find a cheaper Kozel Dark, nor will you often find Kozel Light on tap often. Very old, communal tables, reeks of local hangout...bottom line a great place. Some food available, but this is just a a great pub to hang out in.

properties.name: U Fleku
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Kremencova 11, 5 minute walk from Wenceslas Square. U Fleku is a large pub restaurant brewery serving the famous U Fleku dark beer ONLY since 1499. You heard right, dark beer brewed onsite, and that\'s it. Believe me you won\'t be dissapointed as this should be included in the top dark beers in the Czech republic. and micro-brewery all rolled into one. Of all the traditional Czech pubs in Prague, architecturally there is no finer example. U Fleku is located in an ancient building dating from 1499. This large, sprawling tavern is a complex of rooms laid out in true European beerhall style. U Fleku is a great but over touristed place to enjoy traditional Czech food, beer and entertainment.

properties.name: U Vodarny
properties.description: Posted by Finkster75 Korunni at Nitranska, Prague 3 As part of my beer tour of Prague, this is at the top of the list. "At the Water Tower" is famous for another liquid: fresh Gambrinus, Pilsner Urquell and Kozel from tanks rather than barrels – pubs must consume a certain amount of beer to be given this honour. It is also famous for excellent and cheap home cooked traditional food and that superb habit of singing rock n roll and country and western songs in Czech. Plus they have an adjacent non-stop herna with saloon doors. You absolutely have not had Kozel Dark until you have had it on tankard, it is exquisite, there is a big difference in the freshness versus just on tap or the bottle.

properties.name: Wadja
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 10, Rue de la Grande-Chaumière, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 46 33 02 02 Metro: Vavin

properties.name: Willi's Wine Bar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 13, rue des Petits-Champs, Paris, FranceReservations: +33 01 42 61 05 09 Needed for dinner, lunch walk-ins allowed Metro: Pyramides Excellent wine by the bottle selection with a reasonable by the glass wine list. Willi\'s Wine Bar, while their name does not suggest it, is also a fantastic restaurant, specializing in classic country style French cooking. Excellent meat, Foie Gras, vegetable dishes and stews. One of the best no frills Parisian restaurants in my opinion, steering away from heavy or innovative sauces or preparation techniques, just classic preparation with wonderful natural flavors being brought to the surface. Make sure to take a walk through the Jardin du Palais Royal, it\'s a must see on a warm sunny day.

properties.name: Wirtshaus in der au
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Lilienstrasse 51, Munich, GermanyKnown as one of the best traditional Bavarian restaurants in Munich, they stake the claim to the best Wiener Schnitzel in town and I can\'t argue with them. Great atmosphere, great beer.

properties.name: Ze Kitchen Galerie
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4, rue des Grands-Augustins, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 44 32 00 32 Metro: Saint-Michel

properties.name: Zé da Calçada
properties.description: Posted by Finkster R. 31 de Janeiro, Amarante, 4600 PortugalQuaint riverside location in the historic town of Amarante in the Vinho Verde region. Very local Portugese food!
